body: +1 great

In some cases, removing the @author tag leaves an empty javadoc. I think it would be better to remove the entire block for these cases.

As an examnple:
diff --git a/gemfire-core/src/main/java/com/gemstone/gemfire/internal/cache/BucketRegionQueue.java b/gemfire-core/src/main/java/com/gemstone/gemfire/internal/cache/BucketRegionQueue.java
index f7eaf2b..6b76c31 100644
--- a/gemfire-core/src/main/java/com/gemstone/gemfire/internal/cache/BucketRegionQueue.java
+++ b/gemfire-core/src/main/java/com/gemstone/gemfire/internal/cache/BucketRegionQueue.java
@@ -55,7 +55,6 @@
 import com.gemstone.gemfire.internal.offheap.OffHeapRegionEntryHelper;

 /**
- \* @author Suranjan Kumar
  - 
    */
    public class BucketRegionQueue extends AbstractBucketRegionQueue {

You should rebase your branch on apache develop. It looks like what happened is that your previous pull request was cherry-picked to develop and got a different hash. That's why you have a merge commit in this pull request.
Thanks Dan. I'll rebase and re-submit
Closing this pull-request as this work is re-done due to name change for sub-projects from Gemfire to Geode and the new re-work in on feature/GEODE-52 branch.

+1

If you follow the commit comment conventions at [1] our commit history will be more readable and consistent.  Thanks!

[1] http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/

+1

A note on BUILDING.md - Should the verification steps reinforce that the GEODE install bin directory (geode-assembly\build\install\apache-geode\bin) be placed in the PATH. Otherwise, the steps as shown will fail.

I do not believe that those building Geode from source should be reminded to place a bin directory
in their path.  I think that it is enough, in this instance, to identify the 2 locations of the built
gfsh script and let the developer decide how to invoke the script.

Thanks for +1's. Is anything pending to merge this?

I've revised the BUILDING.md file such that the redundant installDist command line option is no longer included.

I have not changed the Windows build instructions to suggest using the gradlew.bat script.  The instructions modified in this PR are those that should be followed by someone who downloads source from the Releases page of the http://geode.incubator.apache.org/ site. The source from that location does not include a Windows gradlew.bat script, per Apache rules.  I suggest that instructions for building from source when acquiring source from GitHub belong on the cwiki; the gradlew.bat script is still included in the apache/incubator-geode repository.  For the longer term, I further suggest that the Windows gradlew.bat script be rewritten such that it can be included in the source of a release.  Then, there can be a single set of build instructions, and the build instructions become independent of the location of the source download.
I'll merge this.
+1 I'll merge this.
I'll merge this.
I'm planning to merge this PR as soon as my new credentials are activated.

+1
A minor nitpick, could you please make the support email user@?

One more thing:  these changes need to be propagated into the LICENSE for the binary distribution located at geode-assembly/src/main/dist/LICENSE.

Probably best for future maintenance to break that file in two sections:  one for c-n-p of the src LICENSE and one section for the bundled dependencies of the binary distro.
Got it. Closing my pull request and starting a new one to incorporate changes to the binary distribution LICENSE, too.
Is this OK to merge?
Yes!

This looks awesome!!  Only change I would make is to add this to the CDDL license for the javax\* dependencies:

```
   NOTICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 9 OF THE COMMON DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION LICENSE (CDDL)

   The code released under the CDDL shall be governed by the laws of the State of California (excluding conflict-of-law provisions). Any litigation relating to this License shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Courts of the Northern District of California and the state courts of the State of California, with venue lying in Santa Clara County, California.
```
This looks good. I will put it in.
The check test failed because of new element uda-manager in xsd. I will modify the test to expect uda-manager

Thanks for sending this code Asif!

I ran a precheckin, and there are some failing tests.
-    ResourceManagerDUnitTest. testRemoveDuringQuery
-    BugJUnitTest. testBug32251
-    RegionJUnitTest. testQueryServiceInterface
-    RegionJUnitTest. testShortcutMethods
-    UDAPartitionedQueryDUnitTest. testUDANoGroupBy
-    UDAPartitionedQueryDUnitTest. testUDAWithGroupBy
-    IndexCreationJUnitTest. testIndexCreation
-    QueryFromClauseCanonicalizationJUnitTest. testCanonicalizedFromClause
-    CompactRangeIndexJUnitTest. testUpdateInProgressWithMethodInvocationInIndexClauseShouldNotThrowException
-    AnalyzeSerializablesJUnitTest. testDataSerializables
-    AnalyzeSerializablesJUnitTest. testSerializables

I think the next steps on this are to send the proposal with the description of the changes to the mailing list and work on reviewing these changes and fixing the failures.

Proposal:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/GEODE/OQL+Aggregate+functions+and+UDA

Thanks Dan.
I will look at the failures by tomorrow & propose a fix.
I will also update the wiki with the changes description.
Regards
Asif

- LogWriterAppenderJUnitTest.testLogWriterLevels

Nice work, Grace - thanks for handling it.
One suggested correction: the name "geode" should be given an initial cap ('Geode') in the string EXPORT_OFFLINE_DISK_STORE__HELP.
Thanks for catching some other typos and getting rid of 'vfabric'.
Question: Once this change is in place, will GemFire's version of gfsh help contain lots of Geode references? If so, has PM okayed that?

I did mention in a couple of places, however, in generalI think when referencing the project as 'Apache Geode', I think we should be using 'Apache Geode (incubating)' until Geode is a top-level Apache project.

IIRC, the requirement is to mention (incubating) on the first reference.  Here are the branding requirements:

http://incubator.apache.org/guides/branding.html

Anthony
